result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with any known gang members.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.Defendant Joseph M Garcia in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Count 1 -   probation 3 years - 6 mos RCJ -  stayed   -to be used by probation if needed.
Grant expungment if  successfully complete probation and 2 years without any police  contact may  thereafter petition the court

DNA sample & surcharge
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts.  AODA & follow through.  Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent & follow through with recommendations.
Obtain HSED/GED.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment or employment / school to = full time.
No contact with:  DRUG USERS / DEALERS/ gang memebers
FAW / vote / jury service

costs / fine + CC
Sentencing hearing on November 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph M Garcia in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Upon plea to charge. The State asks for w/held sent - 3 yrs probation with 30 days RCJ.
P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 30, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Joseph M Garcia in court with attorney Erin J Larsen.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has been made  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph M Garcia
Current: 3213 Regency Ave Upper, Racine, WI 53402 United States  (Effective: 04-29-2014)
Prior: 313 Regency Drive Upper, Racine, WI 53404
Preliminary hearing on April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Joseph M Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Joseph M Garcia in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
